from pyspark.sql.functions import (
    col, lit, year, month, quarter, weekofyear, dayofmonth,
    dayofweek, dayofyear, date_format, current_timestamp, when, concat_ws
)
from datetime import datetime
import pandas as pd

# Define the date range for the calendar table
start_year = 2020
end_year = 2025

# Create a list of dates from start_date to end_date using pandas
start_date = datetime(start_year, 1, 1)
end_date = datetime(end_year, 12, 31)
date_range = pd.date_range(start=start_date, end=end_date).to_frame(index=False, name="Date")

# Convert the pandas DataFrame to a Spark DataFrame
df = spark.createDataFrame(date_range)

# Add calendar-related columns to enrich the date dimension
df = df.withColumn("Year", year("Date")) \
       .withColumn("Month", month("Date")) \
       .withColumn("Quarter", quarter("Date")) \
       .withColumn("WeekOfYear", weekofyear("Date")) \
       .withColumn("Day", dayofmonth("Date")) \
       .withColumn("DayOfWeek", dayofweek("Date")) \
       .withColumn("DayOfYear", dayofyear("Date")) \
       .withColumn("DayName", date_format("Date", "EEEE")) \         # Full name of the day (e.g. Monday)
       .withColumn("MonthName", date_format("Date", "MMMM")) \       # Full name of the month (e.g. January)
       .withColumn("NowMonth", month(current_timestamp())) \         # Current month from system time
       .withColumn("YTD_BTG", when(col("Month") < col("NowMonth"), "YTD").otherwise("BTG")) \  # Year-to-date vs. beyond-the-goal
       .withColumn("FY", lit("FY")) \                                # Fiscal Year tag
       .withColumn("QuarterStr", concat_ws("", lit("Q"), col("Quarter").cast("string"))) \     # Format quarter as Q1, Q2, etc.
       .withColumn("KeyYearMonth", concat_ws("", col("Year").cast("string"), col("Month").cast("string"))) \  # Composite key
       .withColumn("KeyYearQuarter", concat_ws("", col("Year").cast("string"), col("QuarterStr"))) \
       .withColumn("KeyYearYTDBTG", concat_ws("", col("Year").cast("string"), col("YTD_BTG"))) \
       .withColumn("KeyYearFY", concat_ws("", col("Year").cast("string"), col("FY")))

# Remove unnecessary columns (not needed for final output)
df = df.drop("KeyYearMonth", "KeyYearQuarter", "KeyYearYTDBTG", "KeyYearFY")

# Optional: reorder the columns for final structure
columns_order = ["Year", "QuarterStr", "Month", "Date", "YTD_BTG"]
df = df.select(*columns_order)

# Save the resulting date dimension to a Delta Lake location in Azure Data Lake Storage
df.write.mode("overwrite").option("mergeSchema", "true").format("delta").save("abfss://gold@bigpharma.dfs.core.windows.net/d_dates")
